name: redraft

to draft (= write a version of) a document again, for the second, third, etc. time: They have to redraft legislation that is no longer compatible with current rules. She drafted and re-drafted this letter carefully.
More examplesFewer examplesHe wrote slowly, constantly redrafting his papers.At 7.30 am, the redrafted treaty was delivered to them.It was after this incident that her father re-drafted his will.They are calling for a radical redrafting of the bill.

a second, third, etc. version of a text, a formal document, etc., or the process of producing it: After around four redrafts, a compromise document was finally revealed. The other side may demand a re-draft before they will even discuss it.
More examplesFewer examplesThe bill finally got its royal assent yesterday, after years of debate and countless redrafts.She will be responsible for overseeing a redraft of the plans.Your re-draft of the contract set out things more clearly than our original.
